dct_description_sm: California with 2 place names: C. Blanco and C.S. Lucas.
California with 3rd place name: C. de Pinos. Issued in his: Dell' Hercole e studio geografico, Rome, 1660.
With many more place names added. Issued in his: Siculus sive studium geographicum, Latin edition, V.2,[Map 2], Rome, 1670-71.
LC 467 (State 1 or 2) & 482 (State 3); Wagner 383; Leighly 37; UCB; Shirley 418 (Plate 309,State 2).

California of Sanson 1650 type, with flat northern coast sloping up to east, on map of Western Hemisphere. Sto. d Anian and Terra di Iesso to northwest. Great Lakes are open-ended to west. To accompany map of Eastern Hemisphere entitled: CONTINENTEM DVDVM NOTAM COMPONEBAT JON BAPTISTA NICOLOSIVS S.T.D.
